title: Goal-shy Southampton target Manolo Gabbiadini transfer after first 3 game losing streak in 3 years
text:
Italy international Gabbiadini is also being eyed by German side Wolfsburg (Photo: Getty Images) Share Get     
Southampton boss Claude Puel is plotting a £17million swoop for Napoli frontman Manolo Gabbiadini. 
Puel believes Gabbiadini can answer Saints’ striker crisis after seeing top-scorer Charlie Austin ruled out for several months by a dislocated shoulder. 
In Austin’s absence, Saints have lost three Premier League games in a row for the first time in three years, scoring only two goals in the process. 
Italy international Gabbiadini has previously been scouted by Everton, while Puel also faces competition from German giants Wolfsburg — who just sold forward Julian Draxler to Paris Saint-Germain for £34m. Six-goal top scorer Austin has missed a month already and won't be back soon (Photo: Getty) 
Summer appointment Puel had previously stated he would not be looking to bolster his front-line during the winter window, but his stance is believed to have changed following this dismal run of form. 
Southampton visit Championship Norwich in the FA Cup's third round on Saturday and defeat would heap more pressure on the Frenchman, who was forced to answer questions on his future after the 3-0 loss at Everton. Like us on Facebook
